subject: Photography
title: Photography Ethics in the Digital Age
description: Learn Photography Ethics in the Digital Age in one minute.

hook.text: You can remove a blemish, change a sky, or add a person who wasn't there. Where's the ethical line?

buildup.text: Digital editing tools make manipulation invisible. There's no physical evidence that an image was altered.

discovery.text: News organizations maintain strict rules: no adding, removing, or moving elements. But social media has no rules.

twist.text: Even basic edits raise questions. Is boosting contrast manipulation? Cropping a distraction? The line keeps shifting.

climax.text: Ethics in photography are contextual. A fashion retouch has different standards than a news photograph.

punchline.text: The tool doesn't decide ethics. The photographer does.

quiz.question: Why are photography ethics considered contextual?
options: Different genres like news and fashion have different acceptable standards
Ethics are the same for all photography
Only professionals need to consider ethics
